game_description: Welcome to the world of espionage and deception, Agent! We hope you’re ready for the challenges you’ll face in this virtual reality escape-the-room puzzle game. I Expect You To Die places you in the well-polished shoes of an elite secret agent. Solve complex puzzles in order to survive deadly situations in immersive and dangerous locales. Complete seven covert operations using your smarts, your wits, and the power of telekinesis, a special ability given to all agents in the field. The Agency expects you to escape each sticky situation and defeat Dr. Zor... or die trying. Agent, more missions are available now. Join our Discord server for the latest intel. Good luck and stay sharp!
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Spain)
review_1: In my opinion this game is better than the second and not for the reasons u think, in this first game, u have Ur own office with plenty of stuff u collect throughout the entire game, including cigars, achohol, food, all to play with in-between levels, it feels alot more immersive as you go back to Ur office take a puff of cigar and get ready for the next level, whereas in the second game u go back to a tiny enclosed space where the objects you receive are not as fun, 1/3 of my time is spent goofing around in the office, whereas in the second game I want to leave way to fast, this game is amazing and I definitely recommend to anyone who loves action, puzzles and being a spy
review_2: Here is a very good review if you want to know a lot about the game ⬇️ 10/10 game We're no strangers to love You know the rules and so do I (do I) A full commitment's what l'm thinking of You wouldn't get this from any other guy I just wanna tell you how l'm feeling Gotta make you understand Never gonna give you up Never gonna let you down Never gonna run around and desert you Never gonna make you cry Never gonna say goodbye Never gonna tell a lie and hurt you We've known each other for so long Your heart's been aching, but you're too shy to say it (say it) Inside, we both know what's been going on (going on) We know the game and we're gonna play it And if you ask me how I'm feeling Don't tell me you're too blind to see Never gonna give you up Never gonna let you down Never gonna run around and desert you Like if I got you
review_3: On paper this game shouldn't live up to 2023 VR expectations. As with the previous 2 games you are generally static in the 'world' (although there is more dynamism to this mechanic in this version), the graphics are ok and the gameplays the same as the other 2 games, overall the third iteration is pretty much of the same as the first and second game and with almost any other game this would be a negative but with the IEYTD franchise it is a strength. Schell games discovered a golden formula with these games and continue to build an amazing VR world. Great puzzles, fantastic stories and brilliant use of VR. My whole family play through these games so well worth the purchase.
review_4: Ok, it’s not that old, but it’s older. In terms of graphics, mechanics, and storyline, it’s one of, if not my favorite VR game. And then there’s the soundtrack! The opening credit song is amazing to listen to while doing chores, but when you’re experiencing the visuals with the song? Top tier. I think it’s only topped by the sequel, in my book.
